channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping rubble between 141- 143 Lion Road, 10th November
item.description:
Rubble, bricks and concrete have been dumped in the road. Where it is raining all the sand and cement is going down the drain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked or collapsed drain, 10th November
item.description:
Our road is continually flooding. We believe this to be due to a blocked or damaged drain..the road has sunk next to the worst drain that floods. We have elderly people who live in this road and would not be able to navigate their way through it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clive Avenue, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicles, 10th November
item.description:
I have reported these vehicles on numerous occasions and have even had to call when my last report was closed. Today I have driven around for almost 20 minutes to find parking because of these vehicles taking space

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Flooding in the road is escalating, 10th November
item.description:
This flooding is now coming up driveways and is over 30cm deep within an hour of rain starting to fall. This is now a threat to properties on the road and the safety of drivers coming down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Riverdale Road, Bexley, London

item.title: Amazon crap, 10th November
item.description:
You have received a request via Love Clean Streets to remedy an issue within your Service Area: Fly-tipping report at 122 Burnt Ash Lane, Bromley, BR1 4DD, raised by on 07/11/2025 18:27 Fly-tipping Lat/Long - 51.4197825, 0.0190248 what3words - each.noses.cotton Nearest address - 122 Burnt Ash Lane, Bromley, BR1 4DD

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 71, Burnt Ash Lane, Sundridge, London

item.title: Paths and road needs cleaning, 10th November
item.description:
From Warner Road intersection with London lane down to Bromley hill needs to be swept and cleaned. Leaves blocking drains and making paths slippy to walk on since the rain. Build up of leaves and debris in the edges need to be cleared out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parked, 10th November
item.description:
This van is untaxed since 1/7/25. It is in a very bad condition with broken windows and sharp metal sticking out. It is loaded up with rubbish. People cannot get passed it without walking in the road which is dangerous. It is taking up a parking space which another resident could use. Please help with this situation

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alwold Crescent, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gap in double yellow lines, 10th November
item.description:
Double yellow lines have recently been installed on this corner of Rowanwood Ave but there is a gap right on the bend and cars are parking in the gap. Can the contractor come back and complete the lines so there is no gap please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, 72, Rowanwood Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed since Sept 2022, 10th November
item.description:
This untaxed van (tax expired Sept 2022) is parked on a parking bay, The parking in this road is limited and this untaxed van is taking up a parking space which a legal car could use.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alwold Crescent, Horn Park, London
